data.author: Kane Wallmann

changelog.release_notes: Added ability to combine messages with free type text Fixed bug with message combinations
Now supports arbitrarily typed messages based on Tertiary Text by VGMoose https://github.com/vgmoose/tertiary_text

Increased bluetooth sniffing interval while running Texter (big improvement in responsiveness of app)
Increased phone number length 
Fixed issue truncating contact names with multi-byte characters
Fixed bug that occurred when no favourites where selected

[New Functionality]
Added ability to combine multiple messages into one (enable in settings on companion app)
Added status bar which shows who you are messaging and a preview of the message when in multiple message mode
Added recent call list
Added ability to filter out favourite contacts from recent lists to avoid useless information (setting in companion app)
Added ability to specify a list of numbers to filter from recent lists (setting in companion app)
Added ability to filter out numbers less then a certain length from recent lists (setting in companion app)
Added ability to sort items top to bottom instead of short presses first then long presses second
Added ability to export and import your message tree to backup or share with friends
Added ability to select custom contact numbers when selecting favourites
Contact type selector now also shows the phone number for convenience

[Bug Fixes]
Stopped text from wrapping onto second line and interfering with other items
Limited number of characters sent to watch to avoid breaching data size limit

Added update messages
Added 'message failed' notifcation

Make sure you are running the latest watchapp and companion app at the same time.

data.description:
Texter allows you to create a tree of messages which is then sent to your Pebble and allows you to shoot off quick replies right from your watch.

Now also supports typing messages on your Pebble from scratch. Input based on Tertiary Text by VGMoose

Navigation
----------------

The app uses a navigation system whereby the action in bold is performed on a single click and the action not in bold is performed on a long press of the key. The back button returns you to the previous list.

How to Use
----------------

When the app is launched you are given the option to message either the last person who you had a conversation with or the first person in your favourite list. A long press on either takes you to a list of 6.

You can then navigate the tree of messages which you can customise on the companion app. Anything prefixed with a + means it is a sub menu. Anything else is a message that when you click will send the relevant message to the person you selected.

Text Input
-----------------
While in text input mode the inputs are changes to:

* Single button press take you through the letter tree
* Hold up to switch to caps and symbols
* Hold down to go back to previous tree level
* Hold select to send the message

---

This app is open source: https://github.com/tocsick/texter
Tertiary Text: https://github.com/vgmoose/tertiary_text

latest_release.release_notes: Added ability to combine messages with free type text Fixed bug with message combinations

data.title: Texter
